title: KotlinOutput (Print Text)

metadata.description: Learn about KotlinOutput (Print Text) with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Kotlin Output (Print)
The
println()
function is used to output values/print text:
Example
fun main() {
  println("Hello World")
}

You can add as many
println()
functions as you want. Note that it will add a new line for each function:
Example
fun main() {
  println("Hello World!")
  println("I am learning Kotlin.")
  println("It is awesome!")
}

You can also print numbers, and perform mathematical calculations:
Example
fun main() {
  println(3 + 3)
}

The print() function
There is also a
print()
function, which is similar to
println()
. The only difference is that it does not insert a new line at the end of the output:
Example
fun main() {
  print("Hello World! ")
  print("I am learning Kotlin. ")
  print("It is awesome!")
}

Note that we have added a space character to create a space between the sentences.

★
+1

practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

quiz.question: What is function?
options:
used to output values/print text:

You can add as many

quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of function is 'used to output values/print text:
Example
fun main() {
  println("Hello World")
}

You can add as many
println()
functions as you want'.

quiz.question: What is It?
options:
used to output values/print text:
Example

  println("Hello World")
}

You can add as many
println()
functions as you want
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of It is 'awesome'.

summary: This tutorial covers KotlinOutput (Print Text) concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use KotlinOutput (Print Text) effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of KotlinOutput (Print Text) and how to apply it in your projects.
